intro: Elaterium pubescens, commonly known as the hairy elaterium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild aromatic scent. Elaterium pubescens is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
